snippet: The Square device snaps into an iPhone and allows you to become a credit card authorizing entrepreneur. No setup fees, no two-year contract — you’re in business.

headline.main: A Simple Swipe on a Phone, and You’re Paid
headline.print_headline: Card Reader On a Phone Pays Off

snippet: The British painter David Hockney takes his landscapes and portraits to a popular medium: the iPad.

snippet: Appropriately enough, using the apps that remind you to take medications feels like ingesting medicine — an unpleasant chore, but good for you.

snippet: The company said its new 3DS console would not be available until early next year, meaning it will miss the crucial year-end holiday sales season.

snippet: It seems the rumors that Apple’s chief operating officer, Tim Cook, was ditching his job at the company to take the top post at Hewlett-Packard were just that: rumors.

snippet: Google has been told by Dave McClure to get out the checkbook and buy Twitter: "Whatever your math is, you better do it soon, because you're getting killed by Facebook."
